connector.description: Store and retrieve objects from AWS S3 Storage Service using AWS SDK version 2.x.

camel.sink.endpoint.amazonS3Client.name: camel.sink.endpoint.amazonS3Client
camel.sink.endpoint.amazonS3Client.description: Reference to a com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 in the registry.

camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateBucket.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateBucket
camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the S3 bucket bucketName. This will apply also in case of moveAfterRead option enabled and it will create the destinationBucket if it doesn't exist already.

camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient
camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

camel.sink.endpoint.overrideEndpoint.name: camel.sink.endpoint.overrideEndpoint
camel.sink.endpoint.overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

camel.sink.endpoint.pojoRequest.name: camel.sink.endpoint.pojoRequest
camel.sink.endpoint.pojoRequest.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not

camel.sink.endpoint.policy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.policy
camel.sink.endpoint.policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3#setBucketPolicy() method.

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SQS client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.description: Specify a proxy port to be used inside the client definition.

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the S3 client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.sink.endpoint.region.name: camel.sink.endpoint.region
camel.sink.endpoint.region.description: The region in which S3 client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates.name: camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates
camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.sink.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride.name: camel.sink.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride
camel.sink.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

camel.sink.endpoint.useIAMCredentials.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useIAMCredentials
camel.sink.endpoint.useIAMCredentials.description: Set whether the S3 client should expect to load credentials on an EC2 instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.sink.endpoint.customerAlgorithm.name: camel.sink.endpoint.customerAlgorithm
camel.sink.endpoint.customerAlgorithm.description: Define the customer algorithm to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

camel.sink.endpoint.customerKeyId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.customerKeyId
camel.sink.endpoint.customerKeyId.description: Define the id of Customer key to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

camel.sink.endpoint.customerKeyMD5.name: camel.sink.endpoint.customerKeyMD5
camel.sink.endpoint.customerKeyMD5.description: Define the MD5 of Customer key to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

camel.sink.endpoint.deleteAfterWrite.name: camel.sink.endpoint.deleteAfterWrite
camel.sink.endpoint.deleteAfterWrite.description: Delete file object after the S3 file has been uploaded

camel.sink.endpoint.keyName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keyName
camel.sink.endpoint.keyName.description: Setting the key name for an element in the bucket through endpoint parameter

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.multiPartUpload.name: camel.sink.endpoint.multiPartUpload
camel.sink.endpoint.multiPartUpload.description: If it is true, camel will upload the file with multi part format, the part size is decided by the option of partSize

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to do only an upload One of: [copyObject] [listObjects] [deleteObject] [deleteBucket] [listBuckets] [getObject] [getObjectRange]

camel.sink.endpoint.partSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.partSize
camel.sink.endpoint.partSize.description: Setup the partSize which is used in multi part upload, the default size is 25M.

camel.sink.endpoint.storageClass.name: camel.sink.endpoint.storageClass
camel.sink.endpoint.storageClass.description: The storage class to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.PutObjectRequest request.

camel.sink.endpoint.awsKMSKeyId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.awsKMSKeyId
camel.sink.endpoint.awsKMSKeyId.description: Define the id of KMS key to use in case KMS is enabled

camel.sink.endpoint.useAwsKMS.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useAwsKMS
camel.sink.endpoint.useAwsKMS.description: Define if KMS must be used or not

camel.sink.endpoint.useCustomerKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useCustomerKey
camel.sink.endpoint.useCustomerKey.description: Define if Customer Key must be used or not

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.aws2-s3.amazonS3Client.description: Reference to a com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 in the registry.

camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyHost.name: camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyHost
camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SQS client

camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyPort.description: Specify a proxy port to be used inside the client definition.

camel.component.aws2-s3.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the S3 client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws2-s3.uriEndpointOverr.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option
